1.name: Shaft
1.description: Cool black private eye John Shaft is hired by a crime lord to find and retrieve his kidnapped daughter.

2.name: A Clockwork Orange
2.description: In the future, a sadistic gang leader is imprisoned and volunteers for a conduct-aversion experiment, but it doesn't go as planned.

3.name: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
3.description: A poor but hopeful boy seeks one of the five coveted golden tickets that will send him on a tour of Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory.

4.name: The Last Picture Show
4.description: In 1951, a group of high schoolers come of age in a bleak, isolated, atrophied West Texas town that is slowly dying, both culturally and economically.

5.name: Big Jake
5.description: In 1909, when John Fain's gang kidnaps Jacob McCandles' grandson and holds him for ransom, Big Jake sets out to rescue the boy.

6.name: Giù la testa
6.description: An I.R.A. explosives expert on the run in Mexico meets an amoral Mexican bandit; together they are drawn into the Mexican revolution.

7.name: Straw Dogs
7.description: A young American and his English wife come to rural England and face increasingly vicious local harassment.

8.name: Dirty Harry
8.description: When a mad man calling himself 'the Scorpio Killer' menaces the city, tough as nails San Francisco Police Inspector Harry Callahan is assigned to track down and ferret out the crazed psychopath.

9.name: Some of My Best Friends Are...
9.description: It's Christmas Eve at the Blue Jay, a Greenwich Village gay bar, a place where patrons believe they can feel free to be themselves as opposed to the straight charade many portray in their ...                See full summary »

10.name: The Devils
10.description: In 17th-century France, Father Urbain Grandier seeks to protect the city of Loudun from the corrupt establishment of Cardinal Richelieu. Hysteria occurs within the city when he is accused of witchcraft by a sexually repressed nun.

11.name: Melody
11.description: Two youngsters declare to their parents that they want to get married. Not sometime in the future but as soon as possible. The story is told from the children's point of view.

12.name: Cold Turkey
12.description: Hoping for positive publicity, a tobacco company offers $25 million to any American town that quits smoking for 30 days. Amidst a media frenzy, Eagle Rock, Iowa accepts the challenge while the company's PR man tries to sabotage the effort.

13.name: Diamonds Are Forever
13.description: A diamond smuggling investigation leads James Bond to Las Vegas, where he uncovers an evil plot involving a rich business tycoon.

14.name: The Beguiled
14.description: While imprisoned in a Confederate girls' boarding school, an injured Union soldier cons his way into each of the lonely women's hearts, causing them to turn on each other, and eventually, on him.

15.name: Fiddler on the Roof
15.description: In prerevolutionary Russia, a Jewish peasant contends with marrying off three of his daughters while growing anti-Semitic sentiment threatens his village.

16.name: Chandler
16.description: A hardboiled aging private eye is hired to find and protect a missing government witness sought after by the gangsters. The witness is a beautiful French woman and even the cops can't be trusted. The case is tough, but so is Chandler.

17.name: Vanishing Point
17.description: During the 1970s, car delivery driver Kowalski delivers hot rods in record time but always runs into trouble with the highway cops.

18.name: The French Connection
18.description: A pair of NYC cops in the Narcotics Bureau stumble onto a drug smuggling job with a French connection.

19.name: THX 1138
19.description: In the twenty-fifth century, a time when people have designations instead of names, a man, THX 1138, and a woman, LUH 3417, rebel against their rigidly controlled society.

20.name: Harold and Maude
20.description: Young, rich, and obsessed with death, Harold finds himself changed forever when he meets lively septuagenarian Maude at a funeral.

21.name: Walkabout
21.description: Two city-bred siblings are stranded in the Australian Outback, where they learn to survive with the aid of an Aboriginal boy on his "walkabout": a ritual separation from his tribe.

22.name: Bedknobs and Broomsticks
22.description: An apprentice witch, three kids and a cynical magician conman search for the missing component to a magic spell to be used in the defense of Britain in WWII.

23.name: Get Carter
23.description: When his brother dies under mysterious circumstances in a car accident, London gangster Jack Carter travels to Newcastle to investigate.

24.name: Klute
24.description: A small-town detective searching for a missing man has only one lead: a connection with a New York prostitute.

25.name: Anand
25.description: The story of a terminally ill man who wishes to live life to the full before the inevitable occurs, as told by his best friend.

26.name: Play Misty for Me
26.description: A brief fling between a male disc jockey and an obsessed female fan takes a frightening, and perhaps even deadly turn when another woman enters the picture.

27.name: The Andromeda Strain
27.description: A group of scientists investigate a deadly new alien virus before it can spread.

28.name: The Tragedy of Macbeth
28.description: A ruthlessly ambitious Scottish lord seizes the throne with the help of his scheming wife and a trio of witches.

29.name: The Omega Man
29.description: Army doctor Robert Neville struggles to create a cure for the plague that wiped out most of the human race.

30.name: Nicholas and Alexandra
30.description: Czar Nicholas II, the inept last monarch of Russia, insensitive to the needs of his people, is overthrown and exiled to Siberia with his family.

31.name: Carnal Knowledge
31.description: Chronicling the lifelong sexual development of two men who meet and befriend one another in college.

32.name: Two-Lane Blacktop
32.description: 2 men drag-racing across the U.S., in a '55 Chevy. Dennis Wilson's the mechanic, James Taylor's the driver.

33.name: Kidnapped
33.description: In eighteenth century Scotland, during the Jacobite Rebellion, David Balfour claims his inheritance from his uncle who has him shanghaied on a ship where David meets fugitive Jacobite rebel Alan Breck.

34.name: Morte a Venezia
34.description: While recovering in Venice, sickly Composer Gustav von Aschenbach (Sir Dirk Bogarde) becomes dangerously fixated with teenager Tadzio (Björn Andrésen).

35.name: Billy Jack
35.description: Ex-Green Beret hapkido expert saves wild horses from being slaughtered for dog food and helps protect a desert "freedom school" for runaway.

36.name: Summer of '42
36.description: During his summer vacation on Nantucket Island in 1942, a youth eagerly awaiting his first sexual encounter finds himself developing an innocent love for a young woman awaiting news on her soldier husband's fate in WWII.

37.name: Il Decameron
37.description: An adaptation of nine stories from Boccaccio's "Decameron".

38.name: Wake in Fright
38.description: After a bad gambling bet, a schoolteacher is marooned in a town full of crazy, drunk, violent men who threaten to make him just as crazy, drunk, and violent.

39.name: The Abominable Dr. Phibes
39.description: A doctor, scientist, organist, and biblical scholar, Anton Phibes, seeks revenge on the nine doctors he considers responsible for his wife's death.

40.name: The Panic in Needle Park
40.description: Follows the lives of heroin addicts who frequent "Needle Park" in New York City.

41.name: Tang shan da xiong
41.description: A young man sworn to an oath of non-violence works with his cousins in an ice factory where they mysteriously begin to disappear.

42.name: The Blood on Satan's Claw
42.description: Horror thriller set in 17th century England about the children of a village slowly converting into a coven of devil worshipers.

43.name: Le Mans
43.description: Almost in breadth and depth of a documentary, this movie depicts an auto race during the 70s on the world's hardest endurance course: Le Mans in France. The race goes over 24 hours on 14.5 ...                See full summary »

44.name: Johnny Got His Gun
44.description: In this tragic, dark, anti-war satire, a patriotic young American in WW1 is rendered blind, deaf, limbless, and mute by a horrific artillery shell attack. Trapped in what's left of his body, he desperately looks for a way to end his life.

45.name: McCabe & Mrs. Miller
45.description: A gambler and a prostitute become business partners in a remote Old West mining town, and their enterprise thrives until a large corporation arrives on the scene.

46.name: Willard
46.description: A social misfit uses his only friends, his pet rats, to exact revenge on his tormentors.

47.name: Hannie Caulder
47.description: After she is raped and her husband murdered, a woman hires a bounty hunter to instruct her in the use of a gun so she can get her revenge on the three outlaws responsible.

48.name: Pretty Maids All in a Row
48.description: California State Police Captain Sam Surcher investigates a string of teenage girl murders at Oceanfront High School.

49.name: Continuavano a chiamarlo Trinità
49.description: Bambino tries to teach his brother Trinity how to become an outlaw, but the two wind up saving a pioneer family and breaking up an arms ring instead.

50.name: Ecologia del delitto
50.description: The murder of a wealthy heiress by her husband triggers a series of brutal killings in the surrounding bay area.
